woman.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: I was talking to a woman I met on the flight.
When a woman is pregnant, the levels of hormones in her body change.
woman.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: A woman’s work is never done  (=used to say that women have a lot to do).
woman.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: a word meaning a wife or girlfriend, which many women find offensive
woman.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Did he bring his new woman with him?
woman.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: a rude way of speaking to a woman when you are angry, annoyed etc
woman.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: a female servant or person who does cleaning work for you in your house
woman.translation[0].note_box[0].section: a young woman with dark brown hair
a polite word for a woman – used especially when you do not know the woman, or when the person you are talking to does not know the woman
A glass of white wine please, for this lady here.
The young lady stood up and shook my hand.
a young female person – usually used about someone younger than about twenty
a woman – used especially when you are giving information about women, for example in formal surveys and reports
Females account for 46% of Internet users.
Advertisers try to sell things by using images of the female body.
used about qualities that are considered to be typical of women
You must not cry or show any other feminine weakness.
behaving, dressing etc in a way that is thought to be typical of or suitable for a woman – used to show approval
the womanly virtues of compassion and patience
behaving or dressing in a way that is thought to be typical of young girls, or suitable for a girl – often used disapprovingly
Stop being so girly! It's only a mouse!
a man who is effeminate looks or behaves like a woman
His long blonde hair made him look rather effeminate.
woman.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a British weekly magazine for women, especially popular with married women who have families
